Portal? Oh yes, Portal! That was a great game, but what can one say about this? What hasnt been said I mean, oh yea, how you enemy is funny a fiend (believe it or not in the beggining) and makes things fun, without GLAdos, the game wouldnt exist. Valve, ya don good. Portal is about a part time worker at the Aperture science enrichment center, after a robot there took control of it and killed everyone with a deadly neurotoxyn. You play a chacter named Chell, a woman. (kind of important) and you get tested through test chambers solving puzzles that the root has set up, the backround of this robot is revealed in Portal 2, (you should also get that after you finih this) so you can't understand thi enemy. The enemyis names GLAdos and she puts you through test chambers and then at the end, oh by the way, a type of food is mentioned alot in this game. At the end, well that not actually the end. Its just the beggining. If it is to be the end though, try it not to be. Because, the adventure is up to you.

Portal is definitely a stepping stone in the evolution of video games. This is by far one of the best games and GLaDOS has easily become my favorite villain out of any video game I've ever played. If you're wondering if this is worth the money, I can promise you that you will not regret buying Portal. The only complaint that I have about this game is that it is very short. Then again, if you're disappointed by that, buy Portal 2. 

10/10 Would recommend to friend. Or anyone.

While this game may have been made in ancient times, where Windows Vista was being critisiced instead of Windows 8 (im just joking,) this game retains many features that put it MILES ahead of any other singleplayer game I have ever played (rubbish, I like Half Life just as much.)

Pros:
-Charm: Cliche, yea whatever. The atmosphere, the jokes, GLaDOS, it's all really witty, and it brings charm.
-Funny: Read above point.
-It has aged very well. Seriously, go try play Half Life one again nowadays. It's like swallowing a 10-year old donut. It hasn't aged well. Portal is like wine, and ageing has done nothing but make it better (thanks CoD with your shitty singlepayer.)

There are many more good things about the game, but you'll have to go find out for yourself.

Cons:
-The graphics: OK STOP THE GRAPHICS ARE FINE. They aren't groundbreaking, but this game is from an older era. Trust me, if Valve does ever release Source 2, then perhaps a graphical revamp may happen.

And now the biggest reason why you may not want to buy this game:
IT IS RELATIVELY SHORT. It took me two hours to complete the campaign by itself, and I bought the game on special. $2.50 for two hours of Portal fun. Now, admittedly, Source is knwn for being very open-source :3. This does mean more content, Dev commentariesl, and custom maps. However, unless you have a job or are a Valve fanboy, then you may not want to pay full price for a game that is this short in terms of the singleplayer. If I were you, I'd wait till both Portal and Portal 2 are on special and purchase them both at the same time.


Of course, don't let me influence your choice of buying the game. Chances are your here because you want this game regardless of what poeple say about it. But, if you are conflicted about buying this game, take my advice: Is it on special? If not, get a job or a source of income.

I loved the old simple, classic games on atari and nintendo and often feel modern games put so much effort trying to showing off modern technology by overloading games with features that the gameplay actually degrades in comparison to older titles. Portal is a shining example of how things should be done. It remains a simple, fun puzzle game comparable to classics while using modern technology for graphical updates not complicated gameplay features.

The script is hilarious, and the game is simple, fun and visually appealing. The only negative is that the story mode feels short. Thankfully, there is Portal 2 to help with that downside.

11/10 IGN

...Белая "комната отдыха" с минималистическим дизайном, "программный голос" из ниоткуда объясняет, что это за место, и что нам предстоит сделать в дальнейшем. Бросая взгляд на первую попавшуюся стену можно заметить надпись "00/19" тестовых камер, во время прохождения которых можно заметить через "стеклянные стены" наблюдательные комнаты, они пусты...
В этой игре никого кроме Вас и голоса GLaDOS (Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System), который контролирует всё, что происходит вокруг Вас, но только не Вас...
Сюжет игры не ограничивается девятнадцатью тестовыми камерами, но и эти камеры доставят "испытуемому" массу положительных эмоций и отличных впечатлений. Это игра, где не всё проходится линейно и по задуманной схеме, здесь игрок сам  выбирает вариант прохождения и пытается его воплотить, как такового "шаблона" и не задумано. 
Корпорация Aperture Science, конкурирующая с исследовательским комплексом Black Mesa, а именно Лаборатория исследования природы порталов, в которой разворачиваются события игры. Что вышло из этой конкуренции, Вы сможете наблюдать "переживая" события Portal.
А ведь разработка игры началась всего с трёх дизайнеров из института DigiPen, которые имели возможность лично испытывать на себе "восхищение" Гейба Ньюэлла на своей презентации в офисе Valve, и чьим дебютным проектом уже разрабатываемого ними в Valve и стал Portal.
Обновлённый движок Source даёт нам бесподобную визуальную и физическую состовляющую (на 2007-ой год).
Сюжет (повествующий не самое начало истории) - короткий, но тем лучше, скучать не придётся. Игра затягивает и не надоедает даже после нескольких прохождений(прошёл три раза). После прохождения Portal можно сыграть в Portal: Prelude (мод, повествующий о предыстории Portal).
Геймплей - минималистичный, нет ничего сложного в управлении и воплощении собственных задумок к прохождению.

Эта игра для всех. Я считаю, каждый человек, который способен думать, должен в неё сыграть.

[i]"Portal is the original game of the Portal series. It is a single-player puzzle-based video game developed by Valve and released as part of The Orange Box on October 9, 2007 for Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360..."[/i] 
 
This game is a unique classic and It's hard to find a gamer today who has not heard of it or some of it's references in our culture. It focuses on several key elements which make this game a masterpiece of it's time: 
 
- Short gameplay set in an unknown and intriguing environment that sets perfectly with the story's theme. 
- A unique and fast paced plot filled with humor that gives little to no answers and raises a mountain of questions. 
- It offers advanced and bonus maps as well as achievements that act as a challenge arc that complement the main story's somewhat simple puzzles. 
 
Most prevalent critique of this game is that it's gameplay is too short and the obstacles are too simple. This is true, but in my opinion that is not a bad thing, because after the release of it's sequel this game should not be observed as something separate from it. We should judge games and the content they brings based on the era in which they were developed and the intent of their release. And the original Portal should be considered a 'Tech demo', and something that is intended to be build up on with a sequel.

Something that should also be mentioned is that this game has Controller Support which means you can play it comfortably with a gamepad. It also includes a Level Editor and welcomes native modifications since it includes a Source SDK. 
 
With all that being said, I would recommend this game as it is an excellent introduction into the Portal series and you will finally find out why the cake is a damn lie!

FPSにパズル要素を取り入れ、革命的なゲーム「Half-Life」を作り上げたあのValveが、「The Orange Box」を発売するに当たって、Source Engineをフル活用して制作したゲームと言う名の実験、「Portal」。シンプルながらもどこかValve特有の不気味な雰囲気を纏ったこの実験の被験者は、あなただ。
もう１２年前（執筆当時）のゲームとなったが、初プレイした時のワクワク感そのままにレビューさせていただく。

[h1]グラフィック[/h1]
Half-Life 2シリーズでは前面に推されていた、明暗や風景のコントラストがリアル感を演出する、HDR（ハイ・ダイナミック・レンジ）は今回はオフにしても楽しめる。しかしながら、当時は最先端だったSource Engineのディテールが経営危機に陥った研究室の姿を如実に表現している。徹底的に無駄を省いた研究室のデザインはどこか現実的で、同時に、怖いほど無機質な見た目だ。

[h1]ゲームプレイ[/h1]
照射すると2点間をワープできるポータルが出来る「ポータルガン」が今回のお供となる。これを頼りに研究室のデータ収集のためのパズル（テストと呼ばれる）を解いていくのが中心だ。最初は「ポータルを通り抜け、出口の部屋まで行く」「重い立方体を感圧板の上に置くと、エネルギーが働いてドアが開く」といった簡単な物だが、次第にテストは少しずつ難化していく。それでも、流石はVavle、現実の物理法則の、ごくごく基礎的・常識的なこと、そしてポータルをはじめとしたテスト用具の基本事項が分かればパズルは単純明快である。詰んだと思ってもどこかにヒントがあり、しかも何度でもやり直せる、初心者にも親切な設計だ。…体に全く親切じゃない障害物があるのは別として。

[h1]ストーリー[/h1]
あなたはAperture Scienceという経営が行き詰まった研究所で、前述の「テスト」を受けることになる。被験者としてポータルガンを使ったテストを解き続けるだけなので、ご褒美のケーキは約束されても、ストーリーは無いようだが…

[h1]キャラクター[/h1]
登場人物（？）は被験者のあなたとテストを催しているAIのGLaDOSしかいないと言っていい。Apertureの研究チームはAI技術において無駄に群を抜いているのか、どこか人間臭く、ロボ臭くもあるGLaDOSは研究室の独特な雰囲気に一役買っている。

[h1]総括[/h1]
ただ単純にSource Engineの可能性を追求する意図で、「実験」として誕生したPortalだったが、被験者たちを独特の雰囲気の虜にすることに成功した。きっとあなたもそんな被験者の一人になるかもしれない。直接の続編でありSource Engineのパワーを最大限に生かしたPortal 2とパックで買うととてもお得なので、ぜひApertureへ足を運んでほしい。ケーキもついてきます（ダイレクトマーケティング）

Portal is a fun, humorous game that I enjoyed greatly. It was challenging and definitely exercises the brain. It isn't a game for those with little patience (due to the long and sometimes complicated puzzles.) It might make some cry just from the pure frustration and complications that the torturous and mocking GlaDos provides you. This game might also enlighten the player as it reveals and provides background information for numerous jokes amongst the gaming community. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants to have fun and play with a futuristic gun that can transport you from room to room seamlessly.
Con este juego me he dado cuenta de que los años y los graficós dan igual. Muy divertido y interesante. Además nunca viene mal pensar un poco. Juegazo!

Eines dieser Spiele, ohne das man einfach etwas verpasst hat. Dass die Grafik nicht mehr mit aktuellen Spielen mitkommt, ist verständlich und stört mich persönlich überhaupt nicht, zu al die triste Umgebung für das Thema ideal ist. Man möchte einfach nur raus aus dieser hässlichen Kammer und das motiviert. 

Beim ersten durchspielen gibt es schon einige Kopfnüsse und auch manchen Hä? und Frustmoment, dennoch sind die Rätsel alle logisch und fair. 

Die künstliche Intelligenz GLaDOS ist einer der besten Spielcharaktere, die ich je erlebt habe. Einerseits geht sie einem Wahnsinnig auf die Nerven, man hasst sie und es ist wahnsinnig befriedigend, sie am Ende über sie zu triumphieren. Auf der anderen Seite liebt man sie auch für ihre Sprüche. Ohne sie wäre Portal zwar ein nettes Rätselspiel, würde aber längst nicht so fesseln. 

Seinen aktuellen Preis von knapp 9€ ist es auf jeden Fall wert, auch wenn ich jedem empfehlen würde, gleich das Bundle zu kaufen.

Bazı bulmacalar birbiriyle bağlantılı. Çözmek için önce yaptığımız şeylerden mantık çıkarmak gerekiyor. Çok beğendim. Bulmaca tarzı oyun sevenlerin mutlaka denemesi gereken bir oyun. Ayrıca Türkçe olmasıda bir güzellik olmuş

Portal, at it's core, is a great game for those who seek innovative gameplay, intriguing puzzles and a "Story line" of which has never been approached before.
Although short, Portal is not greatly story orientated, nor is it multiplayer or co-op whatsoever, but it still provides the same entertainment you would expect for a first-person puzzle game (because there are sooooo many of those).
In nearly any First Person game you will find a puzzle/maze like section that does not feel as it belongs in the game, but in Portal the tables are turned. Portal has a nice balance between gore, blood and... wait wait, nope wrong review. Portal has a nice balance between puzzling areas and a first person aspect that has been used many times, but with Portal everything just feels...right.
In conclusion I definitely recommend Portal for those who have a brain, those who don't, well, you can either see a doctor or buy portal (2nd choice recommended)

Amazing game. The use of the portals was very creative and the 60 fps really helped sell the momentum of jumping off a ledge through a portal and launching out of the other portal to an out of reach platform. The humor from Glados was very entertaining and the short challenges made it engaging enough to push forward and not want to turn it off. Took me about 4 hours for the main storyline.
What can I say about Portal that hasn't been said? GLaDOS is hilarious, the Companion Cube is cute, the cake is a lie, etc. Just get the game. You won't be sorry.

I recently bought the portal bundle which included both portal games and I have always wanted to play portal and I wasn't disappointed. The graphics and sounds are very similar to garry's mod, and the gameplay is short, but overall it is a wonderful game and I recommend it to anyone who is thinking about buying it.

This game is great for both beginners and andvanced Portal players. As a new Portal fan myself, this game will test your limits to think outside of the box (no pun intended ;) ) and bonus maps like challenges and advanced versions of the test chambers will keep it fun even after you've completed the game. I will definately be purchasing the sequel Portal 2 and I would recommend this game to all who enjoy a challenge.
